intro: Sisymbrium jacquemontii, commonly known as Jacquemont's mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium jacquemontii is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an invasive species in some areas.
